topic.name: Human Anatomy
topic.description: Fundamentals of the musculoskeletal and organ systems.

questions.text: Which structure primarily prevents anterior translation of the tibia on the femur?
questions.explanation: Anterior cruciate ligament primarily prevents anterior translation of the tibia on the femur, making it the correct structure.

questions.text: Which structure features originates in the posterior lateral femoral notch and inserts on the anterior tibial plateau?
questions.explanation: Anterior cruciate ligament features originates in the posterior lateral femoral notch and inserts on the anterior tibial plateau.

questions.text: Which structure is closely associated with tightens during knee extension and internal rotation?
questions.explanation: Anterior cruciate ligament is associated with tightens during knee extension and internal rotation.

questions.text: Injury described as noncontact pivoting injury with immediate swelling suggests damage to this ligament most likely involves which structure?
questions.explanation: Anterior cruciate ligament is implicated when noncontact pivoting injury with immediate swelling suggests damage to this ligament.

questions.text: Which structure primarily produces elbow flexion when the forearm is supinated and assists with resisted supination?
questions.explanation: Biceps brachii primarily produces elbow flexion when the forearm is supinated and assists with resisted supination, making it the correct structure.

questions.text: Which structure features originates from the coracoid process and supraglenoid tubercle before inserting on the radial tuberosity?
questions.explanation: Biceps brachii features originates from the coracoid process and supraglenoid tubercle before inserting on the radial tuberosity.

questions.text: Which structure is closely associated with relies on the musculocutaneous nerve within the anterior compartment of the arm?
questions.explanation: Biceps brachii is associated with relies on the musculocutaneous nerve within the anterior compartment of the arm.

questions.text: Injury described as rupture causes a sudden “Popeye” bulge and weak supination after lifting an unexpected load most likely involves which structure?
questions.explanation: Biceps brachii is implicated when rupture causes a sudden “Popeye” bulge and weak supination after lifting an unexpected load.

questions.text: Which structure primarily abducts the shoulder once the supraspinatus initiates motion beyond 15 degrees?
questions.explanation: Deltoid primarily abducts the shoulder once the supraspinatus initiates motion beyond 15 degrees, making it the correct structure.

questions.text: Which structure features has anterior, middle, and posterior fibers arising from clavicle, acromion, and scapular spine?
questions.explanation: Deltoid features has anterior, middle, and posterior fibers arising from clavicle, acromion, and scapular spine.

questions.text: Which structure is closely associated with is innervated by the axillary nerve that wraps the surgical neck of the humerus?
questions.explanation: Deltoid is associated with is innervated by the axillary nerve that wraps the surgical neck of the humerus.

questions.text: Injury described as loss of shoulder contour and abduction weakness after dislocation suggests injury here most likely involves which structure?
questions.explanation: Deltoid is implicated when loss of shoulder contour and abduction weakness after dislocation suggests injury here.

questions.text: Which structure primarily is the primary muscle of inspiration lowering intrathoracic pressure?
questions.explanation: Diaphragm primarily is the primary muscle of inspiration lowering intrathoracic pressure, making it the correct structure.

questions.text: Which structure features contains the caval, esophageal, and aortic openings in its central tendon?
questions.explanation: Diaphragm features contains the caval, esophageal, and aortic openings in its central tendon.

questions.text: Which structure is closely associated with receives phrenic nerve fibers from C3 to C5?
questions.explanation: Diaphragm is associated with receives phrenic nerve fibers from C3 to C5.

questions.text: Injury described as hiccups and dyspnea after cervical trauma point to this muscle most likely involves which structure?
questions.explanation: Diaphragm is implicated when hiccups and dyspnea after cervical trauma point to this muscle.

questions.text: Which structure primarily plantarflexes the ankle during push-off and crosses the knee joint?
questions.explanation: Gastrocnemius primarily plantarflexes the ankle during push-off and crosses the knee joint, making it the correct structure.

questions.text: Which structure features originates above the femoral condyles and contributes to the calcaneal tendon?
questions.explanation: Gastrocnemius features originates above the femoral condyles and contributes to the calcaneal tendon.

questions.text: Which structure is closely associated with is innervated by the tibial nerve in the posterior compartment?
questions.explanation: Gastrocnemius is associated with is innervated by the tibial nerve in the posterior compartment.

questions.text: Injury described as tennis leg with an audible pop indicates strain of this muscle most likely involves which structure?
questions.explanation: Gastrocnemius is implicated when tennis leg with an audible pop indicates strain of this muscle.

questions.text: Which structure primarily powerfully extends the hip when rising from a squat?
questions.explanation: Gluteus maximus primarily powerfully extends the hip when rising from a squat, making it the correct structure.

questions.text: Which structure features spans from ilium, sacrum, and coccyx to the IT band and gluteal tuberosity?
questions.explanation: Gluteus maximus features spans from ilium, sacrum, and coccyx to the IT band and gluteal tuberosity.

questions.text: Which structure is closely associated with is innervated by the inferior gluteal nerve?
questions.explanation: Gluteus maximus is associated with is innervated by the inferior gluteal nerve.

questions.text: Injury described as difficulty climbing stairs after posterior hip surgery reflects weakness here most likely involves which structure?
questions.explanation: Gluteus maximus is implicated when difficulty climbing stairs after posterior hip surgery reflects weakness here.

questions.text: Which structure primarily abducts the hip and stabilizes the pelvis during single-leg stance?
questions.explanation: Gluteus medius primarily abducts the hip and stabilizes the pelvis during single-leg stance, making it the correct structure.

questions.text: Which structure features originates between anterior and posterior gluteal lines inserting on the greater trochanter?
questions.explanation: Gluteus medius features originates between anterior and posterior gluteal lines inserting on the greater trochanter.

questions.text: Which structure is closely associated with is supplied by the superior gluteal nerve?
questions.explanation: Gluteus medius is associated with is supplied by the superior gluteal nerve.

questions.text: Injury described as a Trendelenburg gait indicates failure of this muscle most likely involves which structure?
questions.explanation: Gluteus medius is implicated when a Trendelenburg gait indicates failure of this muscle.

questions.text: Which structure primarily flexes the knee and extends the hip during running?
questions.explanation: Hamstring group primarily flexes the knee and extends the hip during running, making it the correct structure.

questions.text: Which structure features has a biceps femoris short head innervated by the common fibular branch?
questions.explanation: Hamstring group features has a biceps femoris short head innervated by the common fibular branch.

questions.text: Which structure is closely associated with originates from the ischial tuberosity with tibial division sciatic innervation?
questions.explanation: Hamstring group is associated with originates from the ischial tuberosity with tibial division sciatic innervation.

questions.text: Injury described as proximal avulsion with posterior thigh bruising implicates these muscles most likely involves which structure?
questions.explanation: Hamstring group is implicated when proximal avulsion with posterior thigh bruising implicates these muscles.

questions.text: Which structure primarily acts as the strongest hip flexor during marching or kicking?
questions.explanation: Iliopsoas primarily acts as the strongest hip flexor during marching or kicking, making it the correct structure.

questions.text: Which structure features passes anterior to the hip joint inserting on the lesser trochanter?
questions.explanation: Iliopsoas features passes anterior to the hip joint inserting on the lesser trochanter.

questions.text: Which structure is closely associated with combines psoas innervated by lumbar plexus with iliacus innervated by the femoral nerve?
questions.explanation: Iliopsoas is associated with combines psoas innervated by lumbar plexus with iliacus innervated by the femoral nerve.

questions.text: Injury described as pain with resisted hip flexion plus fever suggests an abscess involving this muscle most likely involves which structure?
questions.explanation: Iliopsoas is implicated when pain with resisted hip flexion plus fever suggests an abscess involving this muscle.

questions.text: Which structure primarily externally rotates the shoulder during late-cocking motions?
questions.explanation: Infraspinatus primarily externally rotates the shoulder during late-cocking motions, making it the correct structure.

questions.text: Which structure features attaches from the infraspinous fossa to the middle facet of the greater tubercle?
questions.explanation: Infraspinatus features attaches from the infraspinous fossa to the middle facet of the greater tubercle.

questions.text: Which structure is closely associated with shares suprascapular nerve supply with the supraspinatus?
questions.explanation: Infraspinatus is associated with shares suprascapular nerve supply with the supraspinatus.

questions.text: Injury described as posterior shoulder pain and weakness resisting external rotation implicate this muscle most likely involves which structure?
questions.explanation: Infraspinatus is implicated when posterior shoulder pain and weakness resisting external rotation implicate this muscle.

questions.text: Which structure primarily extends, adducts, and internally rotates the humerus during pulling motions?
questions.explanation: Latissimus dorsi primarily extends, adducts, and internally rotates the humerus during pulling motions, making it the correct structure.

questions.text: Which structure features originates from thoracolumbar fascia and inserts into the floor of the intertubercular groove?
questions.explanation: Latissimus dorsi features originates from thoracolumbar fascia and inserts into the floor of the intertubercular groove.

questions.text: Which structure is closely associated with is supplied by the thoracodorsal nerve from the posterior cord?
questions.explanation: Latissimus dorsi is associated with is supplied by the thoracodorsal nerve from the posterior cord.

questions.text: Injury described as loss of power during swimming strokes suggests thoracodorsal nerve compromise most likely involves which structure?
questions.explanation: Latissimus dorsi is implicated when loss of power during swimming strokes suggests thoracodorsal nerve compromise.

questions.text: Which structure primarily deepens the tibial plateau to stabilize the medial femoral condyle?
questions.explanation: Medial meniscus primarily deepens the tibial plateau to stabilize the medial femoral condyle, making it the correct structure.

questions.text: Which structure features receives perfusion only in its peripheral outer third?
questions.explanation: Medial meniscus features receives perfusion only in its peripheral outer third.

questions.text: Which structure is closely associated with is tethered to the joint capsule and medial collateral ligament, limiting mobility?
questions.explanation: Medial meniscus is associated with is tethered to the joint capsule and medial collateral ligament, limiting mobility.

questions.text: Injury described as twisting injury with locking and joint line tenderness implicates this structure most likely involves which structure?
questions.explanation: Medial meniscus is implicated when twisting injury with locking and joint line tenderness implicates this structure.

questions.text: Which structure primarily horizontally adducts and flexes the shoulder during push-ups?
questions.explanation: Pectoralis major primarily horizontally adducts and flexes the shoulder during push-ups, making it the correct structure.

questions.text: Which structure features converges from the sternum and clavicle to insert on the lateral lip of the intertubercular sulcus?
questions.explanation: Pectoralis major features converges from the sternum and clavicle to insert on the lateral lip of the intertubercular sulcus.

questions.text: Which structure is closely associated with has clavicular fibers innervated by lateral pectoral nerve and sternal fibers by medial pectoral nerve?
questions.explanation: Pectoralis major is associated with has clavicular fibers innervated by lateral pectoral nerve and sternal fibers by medial pectoral nerve.

questions.text: Injury described as bench-press ruptures cause anterior chest ecchymosis from this muscle tearing most likely involves which structure?
questions.explanation: Pectoralis major is implicated when bench-press ruptures cause anterior chest ecchymosis from this muscle tearing.

questions.text: Which structure primarily laterally rotates the hip when extended and abducts the hip when flexed?
questions.explanation: Piriformis primarily laterally rotates the hip when extended and abducts the hip when flexed, making it the correct structure.

questions.text: Which structure features originates from the anterior sacrum to insert on the greater trochanter?
questions.explanation: Piriformis features originates from the anterior sacrum to insert on the greater trochanter.

questions.text: Which structure is closely associated with shares the greater sciatic foramen with the sciatic nerve?
questions.explanation: Piriformis is associated with shares the greater sciatic foramen with the sciatic nerve.

questions.text: Injury described as deep buttock pain radiating down the leg suggests this muscle compressing the sciatic nerve most likely involves which structure?
questions.explanation: Piriformis is implicated when deep buttock pain radiating down the leg suggests this muscle compressing the sciatic nerve.

questions.text: Which structure primarily extends the knee and controls stair descent?
questions.explanation: Quadriceps femoris primarily extends the knee and controls stair descent, making it the correct structure.

questions.text: Which structure features includes rectus femoris crossing the hip and inserting via the patellar tendon to the tibial tuberosity?
questions.explanation: Quadriceps femoris features includes rectus femoris crossing the hip and inserting via the patellar tendon to the tibial tuberosity.

questions.text: Which structure is closely associated with is innervated by the femoral nerve?
questions.explanation: Quadriceps femoris is associated with is innervated by the femoral nerve.

questions.text: Injury described as loss of the patellar reflex after femoral neuropathy implicates this group most likely involves which structure?
questions.explanation: Quadriceps femoris is implicated when loss of the patellar reflex after femoral neuropathy implicates this group.

questions.text: Which structure primarily flexes the trunk and stabilizes the pelvis during sit-ups?
questions.explanation: Rectus abdominis primarily flexes the trunk and stabilizes the pelvis during sit-ups, making it the correct structure.

questions.text: Which structure features features tendinous intersections that create the six-pack appearance?
questions.explanation: Rectus abdominis features features tendinous intersections that create the six-pack appearance.

questions.text: Which structure is closely associated with is enclosed by the rectus sheath formed by lateral abdominal aponeuroses?
questions.explanation: Rectus abdominis is associated with is enclosed by the rectus sheath formed by lateral abdominal aponeuroses.

questions.text: Injury described as diastasis after pregnancy reflects stretching of this paired muscle most likely involves which structure?
questions.explanation: Rectus abdominis is implicated when diastasis after pregnancy reflects stretching of this paired muscle.

questions.text: Which structure primarily flexes, abducts, and externally rotates the hip to let you sit cross-legged?
questions.explanation: Sartorius primarily flexes, abducts, and externally rotates the hip to let you sit cross-legged, making it the correct structure.

questions.text: Which structure features runs from the ASIS to the pes anserinus on the medial tibia?
questions.explanation: Sartorius features runs from the ASIS to the pes anserinus on the medial tibia.

questions.text: Which structure is closely associated with forms the lateral border of the femoral triangle as it crosses the thigh?
questions.explanation: Sartorius is associated with forms the lateral border of the femoral triangle as it crosses the thigh.

questions.text: Injury described as pes anserine bursitis creates tenderness where this muscle inserts most likely involves which structure?
questions.explanation: Sartorius is implicated when pes anserine bursitis creates tenderness where this muscle inserts.

questions.text: Which structure primarily protracts and upwardly rotates the scapula for overhead reach?
questions.explanation: Serratus anterior primarily protracts and upwardly rotates the scapula for overhead reach, making it the correct structure.

questions.text: Which structure features attaches to the anterior medial border of the scapula through multiple slips?
questions.explanation: Serratus anterior features attaches to the anterior medial border of the scapula through multiple slips.

questions.text: Which structure is closely associated with is innervated by the long thoracic nerve along the lateral thorax?
questions.explanation: Serratus anterior is associated with is innervated by the long thoracic nerve along the lateral thorax.

questions.text: Injury described as medial scapular winging after axillary surgery indicates dysfunction here most likely involves which structure?
questions.explanation: Serratus anterior is implicated when medial scapular winging after axillary surgery indicates dysfunction here.

questions.text: Which structure primarily maintains upright posture via tonic plantarflexion?
questions.explanation: Soleus primarily maintains upright posture via tonic plantarflexion, making it the correct structure.

questions.text: Which structure features originates from posterior tibia and fibula forming most of the Achilles tendon?
questions.explanation: Soleus features originates from posterior tibia and fibula forming most of the Achilles tendon.

questions.text: Which structure is closely associated with shares tibial nerve innervation deep to the gastrocnemius?
questions.explanation: Soleus is associated with shares tibial nerve innervation deep to the gastrocnemius.

questions.text: Injury described as immobility reduces the calf pump of this muscle, predisposing to DVT most likely involves which structure?
questions.explanation: Soleus is implicated when immobility reduces the calf pump of this muscle, predisposing to DVT.

questions.text: Which structure primarily provides internal rotation and anterior stability to the glenohumeral joint?
questions.explanation: Subscapularis primarily provides internal rotation and anterior stability to the glenohumeral joint, making it the correct structure.

questions.text: Which structure features originates on the subscapular fossa and inserts on the lesser tubercle?
questions.explanation: Subscapularis features originates on the subscapular fossa and inserts on the lesser tubercle.

questions.text: Which structure is closely associated with receives upper and lower subscapular nerves from the posterior cord?
questions.explanation: Subscapularis is associated with receives upper and lower subscapular nerves from the posterior cord.

questions.text: Injury described as a positive lift-off test identifies tears of this anterior cuff muscle most likely involves which structure?
questions.explanation: Subscapularis is implicated when a positive lift-off test identifies tears of this anterior cuff muscle.

questions.text: Which structure primarily initiates the first 15 degrees of glenohumeral abduction?
questions.explanation: Supraspinatus primarily initiates the first 15 degrees of glenohumeral abduction, making it the correct structure.

questions.text: Which structure features originates in the supraspinous fossa and inserts on the superior facet of the greater tubercle?
questions.explanation: Supraspinatus features originates in the supraspinous fossa and inserts on the superior facet of the greater tubercle.

questions.text: Which structure is closely associated with passes beneath the acromion where poor mechanics cause impingement?
questions.explanation: Supraspinatus is associated with passes beneath the acromion where poor mechanics cause impingement.

questions.text: Injury described as night pain with empty-can testing often implicates this tendon most likely involves which structure?
questions.explanation: Supraspinatus is implicated when night pain with empty-can testing often implicates this tendon.

questions.text: Which structure primarily assists with external rotation and adduction of the humerus?
questions.explanation: Teres minor primarily assists with external rotation and adduction of the humerus, making it the correct structure.

questions.text: Which structure features originates on the lateral scapular border and inserts on the inferior facet of the greater tubercle?
questions.explanation: Teres minor features originates on the lateral scapular border and inserts on the inferior facet of the greater tubercle.

questions.text: Which structure is closely associated with is innervated by the axillary nerve alongside the deltoid?
questions.explanation: Teres minor is associated with is innervated by the axillary nerve alongside the deltoid.

questions.text: Injury described as quadrilateral space syndrome can atrophy this small cuff muscle most likely involves which structure?
questions.explanation: Teres minor is implicated when quadrilateral space syndrome can atrophy this small cuff muscle.

questions.text: Which structure primarily dorsiflexes and inverts the foot to clear the toes during gait?
questions.explanation: Tibialis anterior primarily dorsiflexes and inverts the foot to clear the toes during gait, making it the correct structure.

questions.text: Which structure features originates on the lateral tibia and interosseous membrane inserting on the medial cuneiform?
questions.explanation: Tibialis anterior features originates on the lateral tibia and interosseous membrane inserting on the medial cuneiform.

questions.text: Which structure is closely associated with is innervated by the deep fibular nerve on the anterior leg?
questions.explanation: Tibialis anterior is associated with is innervated by the deep fibular nerve on the anterior leg.

questions.text: Injury described as foot slap after fibular head injury indicates weakness of this muscle most likely involves which structure?
questions.explanation: Tibialis anterior is implicated when foot slap after fibular head injury indicates weakness of this muscle.

questions.text: Which structure primarily compresses abdominal contents providing intrinsic core stability?
questions.explanation: Transverse abdominis primarily compresses abdominal contents providing intrinsic core stability, making it the correct structure.

questions.text: Which structure features runs horizontally from thoracolumbar fascia to the linea alba?
questions.explanation: Transverse abdominis features runs horizontally from thoracolumbar fascia to the linea alba.

questions.text: Which structure is closely associated with receives segmental thoracoabdominal nerve innervation?
questions.explanation: Transverse abdominis is associated with receives segmental thoracoabdominal nerve innervation.

questions.text: Injury described as pre-activating this muscle protects the lumbar spine during lifting most likely involves which structure?
questions.explanation: Transverse abdominis is implicated when pre-activating this muscle protects the lumbar spine during lifting.

questions.text: Which structure primarily extends the elbow and controls eccentric lowering from overhead presses?
questions.explanation: Triceps brachii primarily extends the elbow and controls eccentric lowering from overhead presses, making it the correct structure.

questions.text: Which structure features has a long head originating on the infraglenoid tubercle crossing shoulder and elbow?
questions.explanation: Triceps brachii features has a long head originating on the infraglenoid tubercle crossing shoulder and elbow.

questions.text: Which structure is closely associated with receives innervation from the radial nerve along the posterior humerus?
questions.explanation: Triceps brachii is associated with receives innervation from the radial nerve along the posterior humerus.

questions.text: Injury described as weak elbow extension with wrist drop after a midshaft humeral fracture points to this muscle most likely involves which structure?
questions.explanation: Triceps brachii is implicated when weak elbow extension with wrist drop after a midshaft humeral fracture points to this muscle.
